column4: Can anyone help me to get gFTP working?  sftp works fine in the command line, but I'd like to get this gui working.
when you say command line do you mean scp?
Nope, sftp.  I suspect it uses ssh, but the command is called sftp.
which error do you get in gFTP?
btw you can just use nautilus for sftp
If I try to use the SSH2 protocol, I get "Opening SSH connection to ..." and then "Running program ssh -e none ... <more stuff>...", and then it just sits there and never connects.
either File->Connect to server and select SSH or just use ssh://user@site or sftp://user@site
but that's for nautilus of course
Strange that gFTP is not cooperating.  I'll take a look at nautilus.
In the "Connect to Server" window in nautilus, what is it asking for in the "Folder" and "Name to use for connection" fields?
gFTP kind of suck, but I believe you can fix if you really want with another path in FTP->Settings->SSH->SSH2 server path
it depends on where sftp-server is located on the server, on Gentoo it is /usr/lib/misc/
Hmmm... why does sftp "just work" from the command line, I wonder?
uses another path or something I guess
I sort of assume it uses a sane set of defaults.
I can't really figure why either
Anyone know of a gui ftp app that actual works in warty?   :)
maybe it is just us who's stupid I don't know... btw, try checking FTP->Settings->SSH->Use SSH2 subsystem and just blank the path set before
I may not not the correct settings, but that doesn't mean I'm stupid! :)
It worked!  I set the "Use SSH2 SFTP subsys" at you suggested, and finally got it to connect.
Thanks!
